INCOMPLETE BUSINESS CONTINUITY DOCUMENT - BETA CORP
BETA CORPORATION LIMITED
Business Continuity Plan - Draft
Document Version: 1.0 (Draft)
Created Date: October 2024
Status: Under Development
1. INTRODUCTION
Beta Corporation acknowledges the need for business continuity planning. This document outlines our initial approach to maintaining operations during disruptions.
2. SCOPE
This plan covers critical business operations for Beta Corporation's main office in Delhi. Remote branches are not yet included in this scope.
3. CRITICAL FUNCTIONS
3.1 Identified Functions
We have identified the following as important:
Customer Service
IT Operations
Finance Department
Note: Detailed analysis is pending.
4. RECOVERY OBJECTIVES
4.1 Preliminary Targets
IT systems should be restored as soon as possible
Customer service should resume when feasible
Payment processing is important but timing not yet defined
Note: Specific RTO and RPO values have not been established.
5. COMMUNICATION
5.1 Contact Information
Primary Contact: Operations Manager
Phone: Not updated
Email: ops@betacorp.com
Emergency Hotline: To be established
5.2 Employee Notification
We plan to notify employees via email and phone calls during emergencies. A mass notification system has been proposed but not yet implemented.
6. BACKUP PROCEDURES
6.1 Data Backup
Daily backups are performed for some systems
Backup location: External hard drives in office
Cloud backup under consideration
Last successful backup: Unknown
Note: Backup restoration has never been tested.
7. ALTERNATE WORK ARRANGEMENTS
7.1 Work From Home
Some employees have laptops and may be able to work from home. However:
No formal WFH policy exists
VPN access limited to 20 users
Remote access procedures not documented
7.2 Alternate Site
No alternate office location has been identified yet.
8. TESTING
8.1 Test Plans
We recognize the importance of testing the BCP. However:
No tests have been conducted to date
Test schedule not established
Test procedures not documented
Action Item: Schedule first BCP test exercise
9. TRAINING
9.1 Staff Awareness
BCP awareness mentioned in new employee orientation (informal)
No dedicated BCP training program exists
Department heads not trained on recovery procedures
10. THIRD PARTY VENDORS
10.1 Dependencies
We rely on several vendors for critical services:
Internet Service Provider: Vendor name not documented
Cloud hosting: Using AWS but no formal agreement
Payment processor: Details pending
Note: Vendor BCP reviews have not been conducted.
11. GOVERNANCE
11.1 Management Oversight
No Business Continuity Committee formed
Responsibility for BCP not formally assigned
Board has not reviewed or approved this plan
Budget for BCP implementation not allocated
12. REGULATORY COMPLIANCE
12.1 Requirements
We are aware of RBI guidelines on business continuity but:
Detailed compliance mapping not completed
ISO 22301 certification not pursued
Compliance gaps not assessed
13. DOCUMENTATION
13.1 Current Status
This document is in draft form. The following items are missing:
Detailed recovery procedures
Contact lists for key personnel
Vendor contact information
Escalation procedures
Decision-making authority during crisis
Financial impact analysis
Insurance coverage details
External communication templates
14. NEXT STEPS
To complete this BCP, we need to:
Conduct comprehensive Business Impact Analysis
Define specific RTO/RPO for all critical functions
Establish Business Continuity Committee
Obtain Board approval
Implement backup and recovery solutions
Develop detailed recovery procedures
Conduct training for all staff
Schedule and perform BCP testing
Review vendor agreements
Document all procedures
Target Completion: December 2025 (tentative)
15. APPROVAL
Prepared By:
Suresh Menon, IT Manager (Acting)
Date: October 2, 2024
Reviewed By:
(Pending - no reviewer assigned)
Approved By:
(Not yet submitted for approval)
END OF DRAFT DOCUMENT
